this is the sound we wake up to every

before I had to leave Iran i wizard
abadan it reminded me of seaside towns
like Brighton and it is not surprising
because it was built by the British who
came for the oil they modernized the

called barren village these villas were
built more than 75 years ago but they
still looked good
the gardens are amazing they used to
call this area Green Park like in London
we're still using the same facilities
that were installed decades ago back in
the 40s and 50s it was a cosmopolitan
city of luxury hotels seaman's clubs
swimming pools cinemas British pubs and
direct flights to London Paris and even
Washington it was the home of the first
oil refinery in Iran built by the

oil was part of the team but by 1951

fair share of profits and nationalized
the company is evacuated by government
Gora
it may have belonged to Iran but Britain

they made many enemies in Iran gunfire

Abaddon we are very poor look everywhere
is dry it looks like a desert we don't
have enough water to drink
there's no job there are many destroyed

this is the son of the Nahum boon a

Abaddonn sanctions were just beginning
against Iran's nuclear program Muhammad
was playing has got high hopes for the

sanctions my father taught me am boone
he used to perform it in a Scottish bar
in Abaddon Scott's staff at the your
winery used to love dancing when he

Revolution it's a mosque now now look at
me I'm jobless and working as an

day that I can perform the name Boone
for people on the stage I even know few
scottish songs to yawn I want to see the
foreigners back in helping us building

but we want the international community
